meanings.definition: Measuring a small distance from side to side.
meanings.sent1: The hallway was so narrowest that only one person could walk through at a time.
meanings.sent2: The alley was the narrowest street in the city, barely wide enough for a car to pass.
meanings.sent3: The narrowest gap between the trees made it challenging for the squirrel to squeeze through.
meanings.sent4: In the narrowest part of the river, the water rushed swiftly, creating a dangerous current.
meanings.sent5: The narrowest bridge in town was known for its stunning views of the valley below.

meanings.definition: Limited in extent, amount, or scope.
meanings.sent1: Her knowledge of history was narrowest, focusing only on a specific era.
meanings.sent2: The company had the narrowest budget for marketing this year, restricting their advertising efforts.
meanings.sent3: The narrowest selection of ice cream flavors left the children disappointed.
meanings.sent4: His narrowest view of the world prevented him from appreciating different cultures.
meanings.sent5: The narrowest range of colors in the painting gave it a minimalist feel.

meanings.sent1: The narrowest closet in the house could barely fit a few coats.
meanings.sent2: The narrowest bedroom in the apartment felt cramped with just a bed and a dresser.
meanings.sent3: The narrowest parking spot was a challenge even for compact cars.
meanings.sent4: The narrowest table in the cafe was perfect for a cozy, intimate meal.
meanings.sent5: The narrowest corner of the garden was where the flowers bloomed most beautifully.
